measured_by: modified Adult Decision Making Competence battery (mADMC)
justification: “Participant performed ten task sets of a modified decision-making competence (mADMC)… It has been utilized to evaluate task-based decision-making competence.”
“The technology interaction from Franke et al. (2018) consists of nine items rated on 6-point Likert-type scale… The items on the scale were averaged (α = 0.92).”

measured_by: Davos Assessment of Cognitive Biases Scale (DACOBS)
justification: “The respondents also informed the presence of biases in cognition… by rating statements on a 7-point scale” (Van der Gaag et al., 2013).

measured_by: RC1, RC2, A1, A2 framing tasks within mADMC
justification: “Resistance to Framing… consists of matching negative problems in RC2 and A2 and positive framing tasks in RC1 and A1.”

measured_by: SN1 and SN2 tasks within mADMC
justification: “Recognizing Social Norms (SN1 and SN2): There are sixteen statements in these two tasks… scored yes/no or 0–100.”

measured_by: Calibration (CAL) task of 33 true/false items within mADMC
justification: “Under/Overconfidence (CAL): The task has 33 statements, to which HDM must select true or false, and then record their confidence in percentage.”
“Applying Decision Rules (DR): Selecting the ten best features from the chosen choice item is one of the decisions.”

measured_by: Risk Perception (RP) probability-estimation tasks within mADMC
justification: “Consistency in Risk Perception (RP): This task had 10 probability questions… HDM must select a mark on the ‘probability scale’.”
“Resistance to Sunk Costs (SC): There are ten separate activities… each represents a real-world scenario with a possible sunk cost fallacy.”
